block.p: * The Daily News, New York, to Della Femina, McNamee, New York, for an account with estimated billings of about $7 million. The agency was the only one considered, said a Daily News spokesman, adding that Robert Maxwell, the new owner of The News, personally made the choice after meeting with Jerry Della Femina, the agency's chairman and chief executive, whom Mr. Maxwell characterized as the "quintessential New Yorker." The account previously was at Gearon Hoffman Conlon & Nye Advertising, New York.

* Polaroid Corp., Cambridge, Mass., to Leonard Monahan Lubars & Kelly, Providence, R.I., for its technical and industrial imaging strategic business unit. An industry analyst said billings for the account, which previously had been handled by Hill, Holliday, Connors, Cosmopulos, Boston, were $1.5 million to $2 million.
